name: 楊恆隆
objective: General physics is a fundamental course for engineering students to understand basic rules of science and nature. It contains various subjects such as mechanics, thermal dynamics, Electro-magnetic theory, optics, and modern physics. Lecturers can put emphesis on different subjects based on different engineering background. 　　This is an introductory and calculus-based course. Prerequisites should contain vector analysis, trigonometry, and calculus with analytical geometry.
schedule:
Week 1,2,3: Vector Analysis (ch2)
Week 4,5: 1-D Kinematics (ch3)
Week 6,7: 2-D Kinematics (ch4)
Week 8,9,10: Particle Dynamics (ch5,6)
Week 11,12: Work and Energy (ch7)
Week 13,14,15: Conservation of Mechanical Energy (ch8)
Week 16,17: Linear Momentum (ch9)
Week 18: Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Home Work: 30%
Mid-term Exam x2: 30%
Final Exam: 40%
materials:
Reference:
”Conceptual Physics” by Paul G. Hewitt
